info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 3:19PM EDT until June 06 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Rensselaer County in east central New York... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 319 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Grafton, or 11 miles east of Troy, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Stephentown, Grafton, Berlin, Poestenkill, East Nassau, Dunham Hollow, Cherryplain, Stephentown Center, East Poestenkill, North Stephentown, Quackenkill, Potter Hill, Babcock Lake, West Stephentown, Stillham, Hoag Corners, Taborton, Center Berlin, Tamarack and Petersburg. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
